page.title: 19TOURISM, TRADE CHELWOOD GATE
page.content: TOURISM. Ashdown Forest is the largest open space between London and the South Coast and two million people visit the area annually. Recently the Conservators of the Forest with aid from the Manpower Services Commission have constructed new car parks with a view to controlling and spreading the visitors. People come to the S.W. cor- ner of the Forest to picnic, to walk or to buy or pick fruit from the farms which are a feature of the area. TRADE. For a small village it is reasonably well supplied with shops. There is a good general store selling fresh and forzen food; groceries, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks; a Post Office selling stationery & toys; a bicycle shop also elling hardware and garden supplies; a bakery making meat pies and pastry; a printer and two garages selling oil and petrol.
